website_summaries.verdict: A versatile folding table that adjusts to three heights.
pros: Smaller-sized table at 4 feet long and 2 feet wide
Folds over and snaps into place for easy carrying
Nice size for a work/craft table or for an extra food service table
Can be set at 22 inches, 29 inches, and 36 inches
cons: This table is fairly heavy for its size and can be challenging for one person to adjust

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The table was just the right size for my 5 year olds princess party.
customer_reviews.author: Saunders Inc

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the table. I just moved into an apartment and I needed a little table/desk to put my laptop and things on in my room. It can adjust up and down, which is the feature I love the most, and is very sturdy. Overall, I am very satisfied with this table and If I ever needed another one, I would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin

customer_reviews.title: Bad for sewing
customer_reviews.text: This table is fine, but contrary to some reviews, this table is not good for sewing. It’s so bad, honestly, that it makes me doubt the reviews’ authenticity. I’m just your typical sewer, not a pro doing heavy duty stuff or anything, but using your average machine (Singer Talent), this table bounces/shakes all over the place. I bought this table explicitly for sewing and am very disappointed. If you are not sewing on it, it’s perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: SKEPTIC? ... NOT ANYMORE!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about purchasing this table. Thought it might be a little unsturdy for what I want to use it for. Turns out, this table is an excellent buy. It is sturdy and steady on its legs. I'm using it to create a small inside garden with some potted flowers (5 or 6 filled 8" clay pots). I bought a table cloth (vinyl top/cloth underside) to give it a more garden look. I would definitely consider buying another one. This is a very good buy for the money. And I promise you, if ANYTHING changes, I will repost. I have a feeling this will be a lasting relationship though!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect table for my son who homeschools
customer_reviews.text: Love this table! I homeschool my son who has Autism and this is perfect for him. There are 3 different height levels so as he grows the table can too. We are on the second height right now and it's perfect. The only thing is I wouldn't just use paper to write it has the top is kinda bumpy but he has packets so it doesn't affect his writing. He is happy I am happy so it's great! I think I may have to purchase another just to have when we have cookouts it would be perfect for that as well. Very easy to put up and move heights when you need too.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: One My Top Ten Amazon  Purchases
customer_reviews.text: I've had the table for a week now. Wish I knew of it earlier. It is stable in my experience. It does not take two people to set up . You extend the legs by pushing the button in, at the same time raising/ lowering the leg a tiny bit,it will stay depressed --do the same for the other side, and raise or lower the leg as you chose. It's done. This is not new practice. As mentioned before, this simple added 8' square is a great addition. Note : I do not receive any benefit by writing this review -- from anyone-- but my guests.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best table ever
customer_reviews.text: Best crafting/show table ever. Height adjustable and folds in half for transport. I bought 2. I love them. I will buy 2 more unless you all beat me to them.
customer_reviews.author: the Raven

customer_reviews.title: Sags in the middle.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use as a sewing table at an elderly parent’s home & the adjustable height. It gets the job done, but sags down in the middle with the heavier machine. Granted the table wasn’t designed for what I’m using it for but the sag is noticeable. The table is convenient because I can fold it and store it in the closet. When I’m able to work again, I’ll use it when I’m on the road because it fits in the back of my vehicle. The adjustable height is a blessing, but the buttons are hard to push. It doesn’t have any warping or major bumps. I wouldn’t purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Rusted
customer_reviews.text: The pros - once standing, it's very strong. Cons - the lock (I bought 2) doesn't work at all. Not safe around kids if they like to hide under things. One pull of a leg and it'll collapse on them. Lastly, one I put inside to decorate with my plants. The other I put outside overnight (one night!) and it lightly rained. The next day went to fold it up only to find the legs were oozing orange liquid. Rusted!
customer_reviews.author: Prof. Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these, one for my guinea pigs and another for more sewing space. It works perfectly for both. I wouldnt put my machine on it, though it is pretty sturdy. It doesnt wobble width wise, but its a bit shaky when you wiggle it length wise. The adjustable height is awesome. Lowest works perfectly for my kids to use, middle is flush with my other table and the heighest is great for cutting material. I love it and might buy a 3rd.
customer_reviews.author: EmmaJean

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: This table is the workhorse table of our household. The adjustable height, the folded size, and most of all the extreme sturdiness of the table makes it a value buy. No cons. I use this table for family gatherings, and then use it at several heights for sewing projects. It can hold two cast iron vintage machines without a hint of weakness. Those machines are easily 30-40 pounds. In a pinch, it even works as a dog barrier to keep our shih tzu/bichon mix dog from roaming the entire house! And yes, easy to keep clean- good for a camping table.
customer_reviews.author: Barbaraknits

customer_reviews.title: Strong and usually l useful table
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this table to act as a temporary desk/workstation for me and my son during the pandemic. Im a teacher and he's a kindergartner. It's easily adjustable and definitely does the job. My current table is our dining Room table which is pub height, 36". This folding table adjusts to the same height giving increased workspace. It's also foldable to ease in portability. An added benefit is it holds my wife and I when we want some interesting "fun" time. This is surprising since I'm a large man, well over 300lbs, but I'm guessing this is a testament to its strength.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Dimella

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten so much good use out of these tables. I purchased two of them to use in a booth at a street fair. They worked very well for that. I've also used them with the legs shortened for outdoor concerts and theater so we could have an easy place to set food and drinks. I've used them camping. I've used them for doing projects in the garage. They are light weight, easy to store and easy to transport. I had no idea how much I would use them when I purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Fredrickson

customer_reviews.title: arrived with a small dent
customer_reviews.text: Aside from the lack of quality control, this table is perfect. Sturdy, stable, perfect height and size and it doesn't smell bad from off-gassing. I took off one star for arriving dented and another star for having said dent on the side without the carry strap, i.e., the pretty side. So, when using the table, I have to decided whether I want to look at the strap or the dent. :-( It's too much of a hassle to exchange something this size and weight, so I'll keep it, but I am quite disappointed that they sell a damaged product at full price.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Solid and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I see "lifetime" written on this table and I think it just may last that long. Table arrived in great condition. I immediately opened it up and opened up the legs to the highest position. It was a tad wobbly but nothing more than expected. Legs are like from a card table. You only have the short angle that locks the legs open to steady it. I see no issue with it. It's not going to fall over for sure. I easily adjusted the legs by myself. Top of the table looks solid and should be easy to keep clean. It's now packed away waiting to go camping with us.
customer_reviews.author: Agoattamer

customer_reviews.title: Could be better - disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This table should have been a great purchase. In some regards, it has good features, but the negatives rather wash away the positives. Positives: Perfect size for my purpose, Easy to unfold and fold up, nice surface, very portable and handy for many purposes. Negatives: There's no lock to keep the table unfolded. Why? A simple design alteration would correct this. Secondly, and most significant negative - You cannot pull the legs to different heights without a second person. And contrary to TJK comment, I am neither LAZY NOR STUPID. What arrogance.
customer_reviews.author: smcallister

customer_reviews.title: Great home office desk
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as a temporary desk for my husband during the corona virus pandemic when his company had employees work from home. HE LOVES IT!!! It held his work computer, laptop, stacks of papers, and notebooks perfectly! It’s easy to fold up and store in the closet- which I did every weekend since we have a small house and two active toddlers!
customer_reviews.author: Lea M

customer_reviews.title: Nice table. Does the trick (even though we got a slightly damaged one).
customer_reviews.text: The different heights of this table are great, however, the table is rather wobbly in all its different height settings. Folding and assembling is easy as well as carrying it. The tabletop plastic on our particular table came damaged where the table folds but we decided to keep it because it still does the trick. Also, not sure if it's just the locking mechanism on the table we received but even in the locked position, the table folds up a bit when lifted, but that shouldn't be too big a problem if there is weight on the table and/or if you don't plan on lifting the table.
customer_reviews.author: Vivi FM

customer_reviews.title: You don't need an expensive "Overlanding" table...
customer_reviews.text: I laugh when I see the overpriced stuff that gets sold to the "Overland" community. Stainless, Aluminum, Unobtanium (that one is the most expensive)...Here's a great table with 3 height adjustments, great for cooking and preparation and great for just general use. Solid, cleans up nice, folds easily, stores securely. If you're traveling by vehicle and you have a 24"x24"x3" space available for a table you'll use every night, this is the one. Spend the money you saved on a museum admission or some beer and tacos.
customer_reviews.author: K9 Gromit

customer_reviews.title: NO documentation. NO directions. YES help.
customer_reviews.text: This table came without any written instructions whatsoever. And there are none available online. I saw discussion of latches, and some nice pictures of nice people using the table, but none showing how to open or close the table. There is a red thingy that can be put in two positions. But which position opens and which one closes...I cannot tell. This might be a good product, but without any pictures, videos, or written instructions, it goes way down in my estimation of usefulness. Postscript: I called customer service, and they were helpful. I still think there should be something available.
customer_reviews.author: K Endres

customer_reviews.title: LIGHTWEIGHT * FOLDS EASILY * EASY TO STORE
customer_reviews.text: This is light-weight, but heavy enough to not get tipped over. It's just right. It folds easily and is easy to carry with the handle. I use it in my craft room. When I'm using my paper trimmer, I need my table to be a little bit lower than normal table height. We're going to bring it in our camper trailer this weekend since it's so light-weight and compact. I love how I can fold it up and easily store it in a closet or behind a door when I'm not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Taunya R.

customer_reviews.title: Good to buy
customer_reviews.text: Good and useful desk. My classmate recommends this to me. Quick shipment and easy for one girl to open even I need to use my shoulder when set the height. Large enough for me to put my two laptops or one big laptop and my painting equipments. Not too heavy if you want to bring to other location. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: ziyu zhou

customer_reviews.title: How did that past QA?
customer_reviews.text: The table is smaller then I thought, but I like how the legs are adjustable. Perfect for an extra table on the fly. I took 2 stars off because the first table I got had serious defects. There were holes on the surface of the table. And they weren’t holes caused by a sharp objects, it was actually holes caused by an abnormality in the molding of the plastic table top. How that flew past QA is beyond me.
customer_reviews.author: Monster_Review

customer_reviews.title: STOKED !! 👍👏⭐
customer_reviews.text: I am super stoked with this purchase,. Due to Covid virus, I lost my job, a day later I was hired to work from home :) I needed a sturdy table for my laptop etc. This table far exceeded my expectations !!! No tools needed !! Unfold and adjust to my height preference ! I am elated ! Oh, did I mentioned the price was awesome ? 😁 This table has various ways to use,,,👌👍 👏
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: Nice little work table
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a little Lego/model work table for my son’s room. Add a daylight desk lamp and a three drawer Sterilite bin underneath for parts and pieces and it is a pretty sweet set up. I liked that it adjusts to three different height options, though the first two are a lot lower and might work best for a little one. My son is 9 and a big guy so the tallest setting worked best. Unfolding the table was relatively easy though I still do t understand exactly how I got it to unlatch from the folded/latched position. No instructions or picture cues on the table itself to indicate this.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Great.  Almost perfect.
customer_reviews.text: This is almost the perfect lightweight folding table that you can carry like a suitcase when collapsed. I have only one small room, and no extra space for an art table. My husband found the solution. Now, I have this expanded to full height, and set against the wall, over plastic boxes full of my supplies. There is a seam in the middle of the table which is not a problem for me since I will be painting over cardboard platforms cut from shipping boxes. Also, the table is so lightweight that I can hit is and knock over a glass of water. However, I need a lightweight table that I can carry, use while seated or standing up. Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: kstars

customer_reviews.title: Good Temporary Desk
customer_reviews.text: I needed a temporary dust for my 8-year-old to do his homework while I worked from home during Corona. This worked well and move easily enough that we could put it up and take it down or just slide it out of the way but we didn't need it. Sturdy enough for his tablet, working materials, crafts and other essentials. Would buy again for this purpose.
customer_reviews.author: D Wommy

customer_reviews.title: Just plain annoying
customer_reviews.text: Three stars for being annoying. 1. I had to go watch a YouTube to even open the table because it came with no written directions 2. Pictures clearly show a handle, my table apparently doesn't have one 3. This is heavy. I could not carry it far and the box has a big warning that it's a heavy object and requires 2 team lifting. That's not exactly very portable. I know the weight is listed in the description so I guess that's partially my fault
customer_reviews.author: yorkiemom

customer_reviews.title: Good for many uses
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these tables. One bought on Amazon (for $40) and one bought at a store (when Amazon started charging more than $40). This table can be used for many purposes. It can be a serving table, a kids table, an extra dining table, craft table, etc. One of my tables is for our Guinea Pig cage to sit on top of so that it's not on the floor. The other table is for my kids to draw, color, paint, or do homework at. If only needed occasionally, the folding feature is very nice. I love Lifetime products - their tables, chairs, etc. are high quality and fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great Table, Excellent Bargain
customer_reviews.text: After another vendor delayed then cancelled my desk order I was in a bind and stumbled on this table. I WISH I had seen this first! I would have saved a whole month of wait time, saved $$ and still be perfectly pleased with my purchase!! This was SOOO easy to erect and get everything in place and back up and running. It took me less than 5 minutes to get the table unboxed, up and in place. AND...it's sturdy! I don't have to work about my desktop PC and monitors taking a tumble due to rickitiness. BONAFIDE BARGAIN!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Seriously?! Footprint on top of table.
customer_reviews.text: Well the table appears it'll function just fine for what I need, but it arrived with a small dent at the joint and a FOOTMARK on top of it. Thankfully I'll be putting a tortoise box on top of it so I won't have to see or try and scrub it off, but I mean, come on ... seriously?! That's just flat-out poor business and a total lack of caring about quality assurance in my opinion. Pictures included in as proof. And, no, I did not do it; I don't even own work boots (which is exactly what this looks like).
customer_reviews.author: Inked_girl

customer_reviews.title: Just about perfect
customer_reviews.text: Good little table, I mainly got it for the adjustable height, I have a multi purpose room and adding this table will give me a lot of versatility. It main sits tall over my workout gear & I use a stool to make this a work station, but I intend to use it at seated level at times when I work on puzzles or other crafts. It's light weight, so a little wobbly. It was REALLY hard to open at first, I wasn't sure I was opening from the right side & worried to break it, but others said you had to really pull hard, which I thought was a bit overkill. Please I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for craft shows
customer_reviews.text: I use this table for my craft shows. It is easy to set up and the handle makes it a breeze to carry. 3 height settings to pick from. I think 4 ft is the perfect size I use 2 of them in my 10 x 10 booth. Table seems quite sturdy and well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie W

customer_reviews.title: Suitable for only light work!
customer_reviews.text: I initially got this table as a part-time computer desk in my basement. Upon receiving the item, however... I've learned that it wobbles side-to-side like jello. I've used wood and wire to stabilize it. And although better, it's still not good enough to stop the wobble completely. I currently use the table as a shelf. I put boxes and stuff on top and underneath it. That's all it's good for really, other than using it for a picnic, I suppose. So the moral of the story; get a proper computer desk if you need a computer desk :D
customer_reviews.author: Col J.

customer_reviews.title: Love This Folding Table—No Assembly Required
customer_reviews.text: My table arrived early this morning (about 12 hours before the promised delivery date), and I am thrilled. There was zero assembly required: Just open the box, pull out, unfold, then unfold the legs, use your foot to the bar nearest the floor in prep to pull up on the ends of the table, adjust via the silver push bottoms on the legs, and you’re all set. Couldn’t be easier. The table folds easily, and has a canvas carrying handle. It is weighty and very sturdy and stable. Great value. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Linda J. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great, but it is heavy!
customer_reviews.text: Like another reviewer(s) said, it is frickin heavy! No instructions at all. Told me me I'd receive it in 1-3 months, yet I got it in 1-3 days (?). I happen to be setting it up once and using it for a table for our guinea pig cage but, if you plan on using it for mobility/set-up at certain events, it is heavy!!! Schlepping it from car to site might be an issue. Otherwise, it is a great table for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: ptatohed

customer_reviews.title: Nice table but heavier than noted.
customer_reviews.text: We got the white granite and it was even marked as caution. Heavy. I have neck and back injuries and lifting upto 20 lbs isn’t easy for me but doable I had to have assistance to get this table off the porch and into the desired room. I certainly wouldn’t consider it lightweight. The way it’s built and framed as well as its size meets my needs well but it’s much heavier than I expected. I wasn’t happy about that. I’ll always have to have assistance getting this table out and up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A bit flimsy, and diffficult to work with, but it works
customer_reviews.text: Two things: It seems a bit flimsy and the leg adjustments are ponderous. It has adjustable height legs, which is a good thing. The bad thing is that, on it's shortest level, the table is not high enough to be of any practical use as a table. The center and high adjustments are fine, I would say the center adjustment is a normal table height. The problem is that when you fold it to put it away, you can only do so at the lowest setting. So every time you go to put it away an open it up to use again, you have to adjust the legs, which is a bit of a pain in the you know what.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert J. Fellows

customer_reviews.title: Ok but wobbly and damaged
customer_reviews.text: I like how tall this gets, it is actually counter height as described however VERY wobbly when it's set to full height. It's not completely level which I don't mind that much and I'd like how the center of the table matches up with no Gap or height difference in the center. Definitely did not like that my table came with a two and a half inch gash in the top of it and the box looked like somebody had opened it and then taped it back up.
customer_reviews.author: keira

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tables!
customer_reviews.text: We just purchased these for our craft fair business and already used them. I bought one first, took a look at how solid it was, and bought 4 more. What a wonderful investment! They fold up so nicely into 2x2 ft squares, looked fabulous under the table cloths/skirts purchased from Amazon and locked well after moving with one click of the red button in the middle. Thank you, Lifetime. Wonderful product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Discerning customer

customer_reviews.title: It's very sturdy too.
customer_reviews.text: It is just the right size. Most others are not wide enough to hold my sewing machine and it's extension. So easy to put up and down and light enough to take with me for quilting at my friends house. Just what I needed. I was recently asked about the height of the table. Well, I gave measurements I thought to be true but discovered this morning that there was another height adjustment that brings it to 36", floor to table top which I feel is perfect for standing up height for your back. I hope the person who wanted the height of the table will see this.
customer_reviews.author: Deb R

customer_reviews.title: Nice patio addition
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and very easy to store when needed. works great on a small patio deck where room is at a premium. Will be easy to fold and store away during fall/winter time. Easy to adjust leg height and plenty of room on table top for every day use. Seems to be weather tolerant and easy to keep clean. Very portable unit that is good both indoors and outdoors. No i would not try to sit on top of it however it is pretty sturdy. Looking forward to many relaxing times on my patio with BBQ and leisure times. This table the Lifetime 4428 is a good investment for casual time. and yes if needed would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ghostraven2016

customer_reviews.title: SPACE SAVER
customer_reviews.text: THIS TABLE IS GREAT. I use for my sewing machine. It's okay sturdy. I would not mind it they add another lock mechanism on the other side of the table. They only have it on one side. I would fill more comfortable as of now I just have to be a little more conscious when I sew. I love that this table is fold-able and has a handle. After I finish, I can just put it in the closet and save space. In addition, I love the adjustable height. It's perfect for my couch and I did not have to buy a new chair for it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the height possibility and it’s just what I needed. It’s a little wobbly up at full height (36”) but it will save my back when cutting fabric for quilts. I wouldn’t use it that high if I were stacking stuff on it; also, it’s against a wall which helps stability. Well made, and I like the surface.
customer_reviews.author: Karmagurl

customer_reviews.title: Table top is not level
customer_reviews.text: We bought the 4ft table to be used to display some food for a baby shower, the package comes with no direction of how to assemble it but it is pretty self explanatory. The only disappointing thing is the table top is not fully level or straight when locked in place. The middle part where the two pieces come together bulges up slightly, it is less noticeable if you put a table cloth over it which is what we did but still annoying nonetheless as you can see the food slightly off balance. Guess you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: JH2

customer_reviews.title: A great quality table
customer_reviews.text: Its a great quality table. Sturdy. Using as my work table right now. Perfect for the size, but if you have desktop system with multiple monitor, I guess 5 feet is probably the best size. It is little small for my two monitor setup. The other thing is I find it hard to fold the table. When it arrived, I opened it, and then I couldn't fold it back. I guess its too tight. I was afraid to break it in an attempt to fold it. So, I took the opened table to my upper floor. I guess when I move out, I have to do something to fold it. Other than that its a great table and very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: vikram Pratap

customer_reviews.title: Perfect doomsday pop up desk.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small apartment w/ my spouse and we are both teleworking in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic. I needed a table I could assemble at the beginning of the day and then break down later. This table is awesome. I can use it as a sitting or standing desk and it’s plenty big for two computers, a lamp, and a notebook. It’s nothing special to look at, but is a great table if you’re in a bind for a desk.
customer_reviews.author: kegov

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable height is GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my Craft Room. These are very sturdy, as I have a lot of my stained glass supplies (heavy) sitting on them. The adjustable height is GREAT for different areas of work. I can sit a one table for drawing, soldering, etc., and stand at another for cutting and grinding. So far I've bought 4 of these tables, and I'll probably get a couple more just to give me some more room to spread out.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberdougl

customer_reviews.title: Best Lifetime table available.
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS HANDS DOWN THE BEST UTILITY TABLE. +It easily fits in your car or in your closet without having to play real-world Tetris +Not that heavy +Has a handle for easy transportation +Folds into a 2 x 2 instead of being stuck with a 4 x 2 +Adjustable height at 4 levels +Super sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.author: Alex Lebroski

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: I really like this table. I needed a workbench that was easily portable and this definitely fits the bill. It is easy to setup, fold and put away. While I wish it could be a little taller I understand in order to be portable the legs can only be so long. The reason I didn't give this 5 stars was while the legs are adjustable for me personally I wish they had added a couple more holes to allow for different heights. The shortest two positions are close to each other then you have two other settings that are rather far apart. I think just adding a couple more height positions would make this the perfect portable work bench.
customer_reviews.author: Movie Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Awesome utility table!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I had two of these but I bought same brand at different store, and totally different. This one at Amazon is easily twice as sturdy as the others I have. We wanted one to put by the smoker when cooking outside and this one is so much better than our Sam's Club versions that we will end up replacing the other two. Yes, a bit more expensive but worth it for me. You know where to get them now so decide which is the one you need for your usage. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: D. Washington

customer_reviews.title: Perfect side project table
customer_reviews.text: If you’re like me and have certain projects through certain seasons this a great table to own. It’s also great if you have company as often as we do and an extra table is handy to accommodate. I had it set to the lowest (kids table size) by and sat at it with a low step stool. It is sturdy enough to hold all the necessary ingredients or supplies (or both) that you need for a project. I may buy another. Great to pack and carry away when not being used. Assembly was easy
customer_reviews.author: Aminitee

customer_reviews.title: Very Useful
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these great adjustable folding tables, which I'm currently using together to lay out patterns on fabrics, and also to place the 17 curtains which I'm relining. Gives me plenty of work space. I also set them up to sort my laundry. Since these activities take place in my daughter's office space, which we also work out in, it's great to be able to fold them up & get them out of the way at the end of my work day. I love the height adjustability as it lets me work standing without back pains, as well as sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Bookzilla

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy customer
customer_reviews.text: Not what I was expecting. I really was excited to bring this cute little table to our volleyball tournament this weekend. Please read before buying. After opening and putting it up, it very unstable. Also, it’s not level once up. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: cassi

customer_reviews.title: Great disinfecting table during Covid-19 crisis
customer_reviews.text: We got this table to set up in the garage to disinfect various items coming into the house during the Covid-19 crisis. The white plastic top is easy to clean and the height is perfect for standing up to do the disinfecting process. Since there is a fold in the middle it also serves as the clear boundary between items disinfected and those waiting to be. The fact that it can be folded up and stored away for other needs once this current situation is over is another plus. At a price of less than $40 it is a good deal. It is sturdy enough for this use, but I would avoid leaning on it for support.
customer_reviews.author: Vir Cotto

customer_reviews.title: Love it! But received with a minor defect
customer_reviews.text: Was happy to find it available in this lockdown. This is perfect as a craft table but we received the table with a small dent in it exactly at the fold causing a wider gap in the fold. Don't want to return it because nothing else was available. Using it but that gap bothers me :(. Overall very good table especially for work from home, remote school situation. If you have multiple kids and not willing to spend a lot this is an affordable table as school desk.
customer_reviews.author: SociableMe4U

customer_reviews.title: Can't open it...but figured it out
customer_reviews.text: I can't open it! It has a red locking switch on the left side bit none on the right side. No instructions! I hope I get am answer so I don't have to return it....OK I'm updating my review: I'm 81, and recently widowed. I have pretty severe arthritis in my hands. This is how I finally opened it: I put my toes in the open sectionto hold it down and, using two flat-head screwdrivers, one in each hand, I gently pried it up on the sides. It worked!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce King

customer_reviews.title: Great little portable table.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this table for camping. My husband and I use our boat and camp on a local river. This table is small enough to carry and versatile enough to make it worth it. There are several height adjustments making it possible to sit or stand at the table. The quality is that which I expected to find from the Lifetime brand. I own another six foot folding table and it's lasted several years.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty80Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nice miscellaneous table
customer_reviews.text: We bought this table for our sister-in-law because she kept asking to borrow ours! The table is sturdy (medium strength) and not flimsy. It could be extended to be as high as 4 feet. The legs easily open and it doesn't get stuck as some folding tables from costco do. When you fold it up, it has a decent carrying handle. Storage is simple too: under the bed, next to the fridge, inside broom closet, etc. Be careful when putting heavy items on it, though I haven't tested weight capacity, it appears to only hold about 150lbs safely. This is a nice picnic table, or general-use table for home get-togethers or parties. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Blackbox

customer_reviews.title: Rugged construction with 3 ht adj & foldable!
customer_reviews.text: Very practical & purpose built. Folding in half with fold out handle make easy to transport. 3 height adjustment is grest for multiple use. Especially liked the angled leg support mechanism that took up very little space & made use as desk or table very practical. 3 ht adjustment requires a third hand to depress two buttons simultaneously moving legs up or down. Great for desk but travels well fir picnic or standing display table. Sturdy & well made.
customer_reviews.author: JHW

customer_reviews.title: hard to do
customer_reviews.text: Button hard to push in while stooping over, pushing in 2 at a time, while lifting table legs with your knee. Have to do that twice to get table to correct height. THEN do it all over again on the other side!! What a challenge! Head rush, too. If I had steel for thumbs to push the buttons in, and an extra hand to lift the legs, it would be perfect, but those are not sold at Amazon. so I struggle, begging someone to help me.
customer_reviews.author: D Davis

customer_reviews.title: Can when standing.
customer_reviews.text: After my divorce, I bought 3 of the ones that only go up to desk height for a cheap desk setup, worked great. I bought 3 of these for a workstation for when I want to stand and do work. Don't spend hundreds of dollars for stuff that doesn't work well. These are great! Much lower cost for a workstation that has been moved all over and can go moblie in minutes.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say it enough, this is a perfect table. Only two feet deep, and four feet long. Sturdy, easy to clean (just wipe it down), and holds 800 pounds! I bought two for my home, then bought two for the law office where I work. Select your height to accommodate your needs at the time. Then use a different height the next time you use it. Easy to fold and store when not in use, and even has a handle for carrying. Would buy again and again. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Brocato

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: You do need 3 hands to adjust the height as some reviewers said. I was able to lower it on my own though. I’m now working at home and don’t have a kitchen table so I’ve been using TV trays. Ugh. It was driving me nuts. So this table is a welcomed relief! Makes it so much easier to work! I’m very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Frenchy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well built and easy to store table
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to work as a desk temporarily as the pandemic is going on. Thanks to the communist China - many people don't get to work from home. I will use this table for multiple things I imagine. It is well built (probably China) and serves it's purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: First Impressions
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a quick-and-dirty home DJ table for when I'm messing around with equipment and don't want to clear a whole desk. The quick setup and adjustable hight are amazing features - I can set this up anywhere, at anytime, with any chair. The size is exactly as expected, and the table seems more than study enough for my needs. Overall exactly what I was expecting when I ordered, and it stows neatly. Come to think of it I can't even remember where I stowed it because it's so easy to put away! I'll dig it out next time I do a jam session.
customer_reviews.author: Providential

customer_reviews.title: Perfect inexpensive table
customer_reviews.text: This table is so perfectly what it is that I’m about to buy my fifth. I keep my reptile tanks on them and they’ve proven solid as well as warp and stain proof. They’re also incredibly lightweight and easy to store when not in use. Could not ask for more out of an inexpensive folding table!
customer_reviews.author: Ali & Vin

customer_reviews.title: Two person job to set up table
customer_reviews.text: The product is a good value. It is also sturdy and portable. BUT, almost impossible to set up by one person. Problem is there are 3 height settings. In order to use the highest setting, the leg unit passes two openings and you must push the spring loaded "stops" back into the the leg(s). That takes two hands and a second person is needed to pull the leg set. And you must do that twice for each leg set. Very awkward and annoying. I would return this unit but I cannot find a better alternative. Seems like a nice project for 1st graders to solve!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Versatile lightweight folding table great for so many projects!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a folding table for my husband to use while working from home during COVID 19. However, I am finding so many uses for this table. For starters, we have found the following uses so far: Game table, portable desk, outdoor BBQ table, sewing/craft table, rummage sale table, and extra seating table, just to name a few. I love the fact that it folds in half for easy storage and portability, it's fairly lightweight, and has an adjustable height of 22", 29" or 36".
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Looks used!
customer_reviews.text: This is literally my first review on Amazon and I have been a member for years. But today I was looking forward to this table during isolation for projects etc and It looks used. No instructions came with. Just a table that has spots here and there. Why it may not take a rocket scientist to open this table and extend the legs a diagram would have helped! I literally have no clue how! So very disappointed! Sending back! 😩 bummed
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive and lightweight desk option
customer_reviews.text: Hubby needed something Inexpensive for an outdoor temporary work station in backyard. This works well for our purposes. Would even use indoors for a Work station too (wish we had saved hundreds of thrown away dollars on a show only crate and barrel desk for our office inside). This is the right price for us. Decent quality. A bit lightweight but that’s what we were looking for. Easier to move around. Happy with purchase!!! Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CC✨👩🏻‍🍳✨

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Height Adjustments
customer_reviews.text: The table is a little shaky at maximum height but this is to be expected due to the folding nature of the item. I have an idea to stiffen things up for my purposes. Overall, I’m very satisfied with this purchase. The table top is robust and cleans easily. With the height adjustability it’s possible to use the lowest setting for a children’s table at an outdoor barbecue, medium height for a buffet line or the highest as a light duty portable work bench. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: As a quilter and sewer, height on a cutting table is extremely important in reducing back stress. With the variable heights it can serve both shorter and taller people. Being portable makes it great to move to a different spot without difficulty. With the higher position, storage can be kept underneath. This is a really terrific item and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: QuiltLadyCo

customer_reviews.title: Nice table!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice table and I am big fan of the Lifetime products, but this one is a little clunky on the set up and break down. One person can do it, but two would be better. I own 3 other Lifetime folding tables and they are amazing simply and easy. This one takes too many steps to set up and break down by comparison. You basically need one more hand to do it by yourself easily. So if you are going to set it up and leave it up for a while (weeks or months), you should be good. If you set up and break it down daily, like me, you may want to try another Lifetime table.
customer_reviews.author: T-Ray

customer_reviews.title: Great table for the kitchen if you don’t have a long counter top.
customer_reviews.text: After unfolding the table stand the table up and then put one foot on the lower bar at the bottom of the table and place your fingers on those little silver bottons. Press the bottoms and while pressing pull the table up. This table can get pretty high about upper chest height. As far as sturdiness.. as long as you’re not shaking it or bumping into it it stays put. I’m using in my kitchen and I’ve placed my 2 burner electric stove and my electric oven on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: Deena

customer_reviews.title: Good table. Love the height adjustability.
customer_reviews.text: Good product and love the height adjustability. Would’ve helped to have instructions on how to open it outside on the outside of the folded table. The table didn’t unfold easily which is great but not when you’re trying it for the first time. I kept thinking I was going to break it then with a little more force it popped out of the latch that holds it in place. When locked it isn’t completely locked in flat. You can fold the two halves a few degrees in the locked position. Not that I think it will affect the sturdiness for use. I think it’s a good table and will serve its purpose well.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Can you give me a hand?
customer_reviews.text: This product is a mixture of awesome and aw heck. It is solid and perfectly sized. It is perfectly priced too. However, I really need three hands to operate it. To move legs up or down requires pushing in two opposite side locking buttons WHILE moving legs up/down. To fold legs in requires displacing securing brackets on opposite sides WHILE rotating legs in. Is doable with only two hands but....... The simple answer is to use two hands and a foot. See photo
customer_reviews.author: aVeryVeryLongTime Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good table! Easy to set up, adjustable height, versatile.
customer_reviews.text: This is a convenient size, not too small to be useless, not too big to carry. Folds & unfolds easily. Has carrying handle. Lightweight but surprisingly sturdy. And the legs are designed so they don't get in way of your own legs when sitting at it (a flaw of some other models' designs). Good purchase. Bought a 2nd one after I saw how good this one is for my uses.
customer_reviews.author: Design Magic

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced. Newer model for same price elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately Amazon censored my original review with a video comparing the old and new model. This same brand and exact size/spec can be bought at a local home improvement store for the same price but with a critical difference: one button to raise or lower the table. Vs two on this older model. As for the actual table it is wobbly but great on the lower settings. I can't imagine a better table size for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison Y.

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE AND DEFECTIVE
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE DEFECTIVE PRODUCT,Smdh, WOBBLY WOBBLY LEGS, also DOESNT LOCK THE TOP ,the MOST IMPORTANT PART OF ALL.. I went back to check on the price and now it’s $30 higher, I guess they sent me the last defective one for half the price👎🏽👎🏽.. ... I don’t wanna go through the whole packing and sending it back hassle and dealing with ups slow a** process, so I won’t b asking for a refund .(0) STARS FROM ME
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Very decent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great table for the price. It folds up so you can store it in a closet or pantry and has a handle to carry if you plan to use the table outdoors in the backyard or at a park. It's large enough for 4 people to comfortably sit and eat or play cards or board games. This table is perfect for use as a computer desk. It's very sturdy under normal limits and is height adjustable. An adult should not try to sit or stand on this table or it will break or collapse. Easy to clean just wipe with any household cleaner. I'd highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C

customer_reviews.title: Stubborn legs!
customer_reviews.text: I am a bit disappointed that it takes two people to adjust the legs. It is difficult to push in the button on one side and not be able to get to the other side to also push in that button to pull the leg up. You just can’t pull-up the one side without the other side being dealt with! Really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Hoffmann

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and quick fix to my new home office needs!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a temporary desk for our new “at home offices” until I could get a couple of ikea tables - knew I’d use it for camping after that. Sturdy at all heights but if you forget to latch the red switch then it is uneven and unbalanced. It’s very compact and held up great for camping! Put a table cloth over it and a few accessories to attempt to make it seem like a separate space from the living room.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Lamb

customer_reviews.title: I've got 6 of these little tables already!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? So many uses, lightweight, easy to move and adjustable height which is great as I have a bad back and sometimes need the table higher for projects. I now have 6 of these sized tables and several larger folding tables around the house. Hey, I'm a single man, retired and divorced. I got projects going on in every room of my house and these tables are perfect for my needs. I'd submit a photo but at the moment the tables are so cluttered with 'stuff' I'm embarrassed to show them off. And despite what other reviewers say, they are for me plenty stable and set up or take down in a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Sac7000

customer_reviews.title: Multi use table
customer_reviews.text: I’m very happy with this table. I like that I can make it low enough for my toddlers to do crafts and draw while standing. We have also used it for parties to set up a dessert table and we made it tall enough so the kids can’t get into the sweets. It’s built very well. Easy setup.
customer_reviews.author: SM5

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to open
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this if you are like me, an older woman with arthritis in your hands and lives alone. It is impossible to open and use this table if you aren't strong. I checked the website and it says "the clips are tight but they will loosen over time." Ha. In this time of social distancing, this thing will just take up space and act as a 24 x 24 inch paperweight because I have no one to come open it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Sayre

customer_reviews.title: Great Adjustable Table
customer_reviews.text: This is surprisingly sturdy portable table is wonderful for sewing on. It does not bounce and at its highest is perfect height to not have to bend over while sewing. Setting it up and taking it down requires 2 people; 1 to push the buttons and 1 to pull or push legs up or down. Very tight fitting which make it a secure adjustment. At it lowest would be perfect for young children or a game table while sitting on the floor for adults!! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Deals Queen

customer_reviews.title: Total Blessing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I own a small out of home business making dolls and my work area always seems to be either too small or too cluttered taking away from my productivity. For the holidays I had 32 orders to fill so organization is a priority. This table allows me the comfort of sitting and working as well as standing and working with just a press of the buttons located on the legs. I was able to keep all my work tools within arms reach, including my sewing machine, and the work began to flow ... !! I could never express the level of satisfaction I sense with each working day.
customer_reviews.author: David G Bellerose

customer_reviews.title: Great table!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my sewing room, to offer that extra flat surface that's always missing there. I own a couple of other Lifetime tables, which wear well and are sturdy, and this one did not disappoint. The legs are sturdy and adjustable, and while the table is a bit top-heavy at its highest setting (due to the top being so heavy), I have not found that to be an issue at all. Shipping was very fast, arriving well ahead of the scheduled delivery promise, and it was well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Chance

customer_reviews.title: Basic and reasonably stable
customer_reviews.text: This table arrived today and it was what I expected since I had seen it before at a friend's home used as an extra table for the kids. It is 4'x 2', adjustable heights are 24", 29", 36" as described. I took away a star because there is a small dent in the middle of the table where it folds in half. This is a little strange since it came in a new unopened undamaged box. It doesn't bother me enough to return it though.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: ADJUSTING HEIGHT IS DIFFICULT FOR ONE PERSON (doable but  requires agility)
customer_reviews.text: this table is difficult for one person to adjust the height by themselves.The video instruction from Lifetime shows TWO PEOPLE ADJUSTING THE HEIGHT--unfortunately I did not view that before ordering it. Thankfully there is an answer to a question suggesting how this can be done by one person; however, it takes some agility---and hurt my hand a bit. I am keeping it, since I will mostly use at one height. I like the table, but unless you are a relatively strong, agile person, you will need another person to adjust height.
customer_reviews.author: Constant Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great dog grooming table
customer_reviews.text: I decided to by this waterproof table instead of the typical grooming table because those are made of pressed board and only serve one purpose. I can use this adjustable table for many things. It would be a great bar table with a tablecloth for a party. Could be used for a display table for a Christmas village. I used it in a garage sale. Very convenient. Just a little hard to open & close, but doable. Lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Barbie

customer_reviews.title: Unstable and horrible!
customer_reviews.text: We paid almost $60 for this table. It is horrible! It is hard to unfold, once it is set up, it doesn't stay flat and is very unstable. It is absolutely worthless and a waste of quite a bit of money. We have a Lifetime table we bought several years ago that we love. I don't know how their quality could go so downhill. DO NOT WASTE TOUR MONEY ON THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: lane1000

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: The height adjustment is a little bit of work but it can be handled by one person. The only reason for 4 stars on assembly and folding is the fact that it's not simply a fold it open and fold it closed when the legs need to be extended; it'll take an extra minute or two. But, in the end, it's perfect for my needs and I wouldn't pass on it because of the leg adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: stanjk

customer_reviews.title: I use this for my outdoor patio office
customer_reviews.text: I love this table. I use it for my outdoor patio office. One of my cats sleeps on it while I do office work on my laptop and I still have room to sit my coffee and phone next to me. It is very sturdy and light, easy to open up. In the winter I will store it away in the shed and it won't take up much room. Perfect and proper height for sitting with adult chairs.
customer_reviews.author: S. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to adjust.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a table to use as a desk in my home office. This one looked good. It probably is a decent table, but I live alone and it is impossible to adjust the height of the table by myself. Since the legs have to be on the shortest setting to fold it back up, I can't put it away myself either. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: EW NY

customer_reviews.title: Love the height options
customer_reviews.text: We use this wonderful table for camping. I use it mostly at the highest level as a counter for my kitchen area. This along with my kitchen set gives me over 6 feet of counter space and I love it. It is a little challenging to set up and take down but my body seems to have just the right dimensions to use my knee or elbows to get the job done. It is harder for my taller husband. It is not sturdy enough to sit on but seems plenty strong for anything I want to do it the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Tjcoyote

customer_reviews.title: Very nice craft table:
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a table a lot flimsier for the price tag on this table. I was very pleasantly surprised by the quality and the features on this table. It has a carrying handle and it can be raised or lowered to your needs. It also is very easy to fold and unfold. I would recommend this table to anyone needing an adjustable table for playing Bridge, puzzles, and or crafts.
customer_reviews.author: Michele C. Barczynski

customer_reviews.title: Size and adjustable legs
customer_reviews.text: Good size work table for small spaces. The legs adjust to vary height. It is difficult to adjust the legs, there are holes and you move the leg up or down until the push button clicks in. I found this very difficult and awkward. You hold the button in with a finger and slide the leg. It is ideal to get all of the legs adjusted at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Durable. Easy to fold. Good table to get.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it’s supposed to. My mom needed a folding table along with a table durable enough to hold baskets of clothes and other things. We’ve had this table for over a year now and it’s been perfect. Easy to fold up and very durable. Good table to get for general use.
customer_reviews.author: Max

product_meta.title: Lifetime Height Adjustable Craft Camping and Utility Folding Table, 4 ft, 4'/48 x 24, White Granite
product_meta.description: Lifetime 4-Foot Light Commercial Fold-In-Half Adjustable Table - Features a 48-Inch x 24-Inch molded tabletop (white granite) with a round folding frame (gray). This table has three adjustable height settings (22-inch, 24-Inch, 29-Inch and 36-Inch) and comes with a 2-year limited . No matter where your hobbies take you, the Lifetime 4 ft. Adjustable Fold-in-Half Table is the perfect companion. From crafty creations at home to painting in a natural outdoor setting, this portable craft table is ready to go where you go. The table is designed with three different height settings to accommodate your various needs and projects, and a stain-resistant surface so it's easy to clean. When you've finished your masterpiece, simply fold up your portable craft table and store it until your next burst of inspiration
feature_bullets: All purpose table constructed of powder-coated steel and high-density polyethylene plastic
Folds in half for easy storage and transport; Great for taking on the go
Convenient carry handle; Table weight: 19 lbs.Table Top Thickness:1.4 inch
Frame tubing diameter: 25mm; Meets ANSI/BIFMA standards

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars9,870 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
